title: Resistive force - change in velocity of object

content.question: An object of mass <math alttext="m" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>m</mi></math> is released from rest at time <math alttext="t equals 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>0</mn></math> near Earth’s surface and experiences a resistive force of <math alttext="F sub R equals negative k v" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>F</mi><mi>R</mi></msub><mo>=</mo><mo>−</mo><mi>k</mi><mi>v</mi></math>, where <math alttext="k" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>k</mi></math> is a positive constant with units of <math alttext="newton seconds per meter" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mtext>N</mtext><mo>⋅</mo><mtext>s</mtext><mo>/</mo><mtext>m</mtext></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="v" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>v</mi></math> is in <math alttext="meters per second" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mtext>m</mtext><mo>/</mo><mtext>s</mtext></mstyle></math>. What is the change in the object’s speed between <math alttext="t equals m over k" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mi>m</mi><mi>k</mi></mfrac></math> and <math alttext="t equals 4 times m over k" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>4</mn><mfrac><mi>m</mi><mi>k</mi></mfrac></math>?

choices.label: <math alttext="the fraction m g over k, end fraction, times, the fraction with numerator e minus 1, and denominator e, end fraction" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mfrac><mrow><mi>m</mi><mi>g</mi></mrow><mi>k</mi></mfrac><mrow><mo>(</mo><mfrac><mrow><mi>e</mi><mo>−</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow><mi>e</mi></mfrac><mo>)</mo></mrow></math>

<math alttext="the fraction m g over k, end fraction, times, the fraction with numerator e cubed minus 1, and denominator e cubed, end fraction" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mfrac><mrow><mi>m</mi><mi>g</mi></mrow><mi>k</mi></mfrac><mrow><mo>(</mo><mfrac><mrow><msup><mi>e</mi><mn>3</mn></msup><mo>−</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow><msup><mi>e</mi><mn>3</mn></msup></mfrac><mo>)</mo></mrow></math>

<math alttext="the fraction m g over k, end fraction, times, the fraction with numerator e cubed minus 1, and denominator e to the fourth power, end fraction" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mfrac><mrow><mi>m</mi><mi>g</mi></mrow><mi>k</mi></mfrac><mrow><mo>(</mo><mfrac><mrow><msup><mi>e</mi><mn>3</mn></msup><mo>−</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow><msup><mi>e</mi><mn>4</mn></msup></mfrac><mo>)</mo></mrow></math>

<math alttext="the fraction m g over k, end fraction, times, the fraction with numerator e to the fourth power, minus 1, and denominator e to the fourth power, end fraction" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mfrac><mrow><mi>m</mi><mi>g</mi></mrow><mi>k</mi></mfrac><mrow><mo>(</mo><mfrac><mrow><msup><mi>e</mi><mn>4</mn></msup><mo>−</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow><msup><mi>e</mi><mn>4</mn></msup></mfrac><mo>)</mo></mrow></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="the fraction m g over k, end fraction, times, the fraction with numerator e cubed minus 1, and denominator e to the fourth power, end fraction" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mfrac><mrow><mi>m</mi><mi>g</mi></mrow><mi>k</mi></mfrac><mrow><mo>(</mo><mfrac><mrow><msup><mi>e</mi><mn>3</mn></msup><mo>−</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow><msup><mi>e</mi><mn>4</mn></msup></mfrac><mo>)</mo></mrow></math>

skill.text: 2.A: Derive a symbolic expression from known quantities by selecting and following a logical mathematical pathway.
